question: On a modern commercial aircraft, the FMS provides?

choices.choice: Lateral and vertical navigation, and guidance and performance management.
A 3D area navigation and an air/ground datalink.

subject: Radio Navigation

question: The Control Display Unit (CDU) on an FMS is?

choices.choice: Used by the crew to input data to the FMC.
Used on the ground only to monitor the maintenance procedures.
The system used to update the navigation database.

subject: Radio Navigation

question: By which of the following flight deck equipment are the waypoints inserted into an FMS RNA V system by the pilot?
subject: Radio Navigation

question: The FMS navigation database usually contains: 1. Airport reference data. 2. ATC frequencies. 3. Company routes. 4. Company routes. 5. Nav aid frequencies. The combination regrouping all of the correct statements is?
subject: Radio Navigation

question: Output from which of the following combination of navigation sources provides enough information to the RNA V equipment to calculate the wind vector?

choices.choice: Inertial reference system and the air data computer.
Inertial reference system and the Global Positioning System.
Compass system and the inertial reference system.
Global positioning system and the compass system.

subject: Radio Navigation

question: On modern passenger aircraft, the navigation database usually contain?
subject: Radio Navigation

question: What is Cross Track Distance (XTK distance) in an Area Navigation System?

choices.choice: Distance between the actual position and great circle track between active waypoints.
Distance between the actual position and next waypoint.
Distance between the air position and great circle track between active waypoints.
Distance between the air position and the planned track.

subject: Radio Navigation

question: In what piece of FMS equipment will the pilot enter the waypoint information for the route?
subject: Radio Navigation

question: A FMS with only a multiple DME sensor operating shall have a position error, 95% probability, in a non-precision approach equal to or less than?
subject: Radio Navigation

question: Which of the following are stored in the navigation database of the Flight Management System (FMS)? 1. Waypoints. 2. Details of radio navigation aids, 3. Optimum altitudes. 4. Company route. 5. Landing reference speeds.
subject: Radio Navigation

question: Which of the following data can be found in the navigation database? 1. SIDs and STARs. 2. Radio aids. 3.Optimum flight levels. 4. Company routes. 5. Cruise speeds.
subject: Radio Navigation

question: In the Flight Management Computer (FMC) of the FIight Management System (FMS) data relating to waypoints is stored in the?
subject: Radio Navigation

question: The Flight Management System (FMS) is organised in such a way that the pilot can?

choices.choice: Insert navigation data between two database updates.
Read and write at any time in the database.
Modify the database between two updates.

subject: Radio Navigation

question: Area Navigation is a method of navigation that permits aircraft operation on any desired flight path within the limits of the capability of self-contained system. Which of the following system is such a self-contained system?
subject: Radio Navigation

question: The Flight Management System (FMS) is organised in such a way that?

choices.choice: The pilot is able to modify the navigation database in the FMC between two updates.
The navigation database of the FMC is created by the pilot.
The navigation database of the FMC is valid for one year.
The navigation database is read only to the pilot.

subject: Radio Navigation

question: Which of the following data can be found in the performance database? 1. SIDs and STARs. 2. Radio aids. 3.Optimum flight levels. 4. Company routes. 5. Cruise speeds.
explanation:
• Performance Database: This database holds information about the aircraftâ€™s performance capabilities, including:

    • Optimum flight levels.

    • Cruise speeds.

    • Other aircraft-specific performance data.

  • Navigation Database: This database stores critical navigation data, including:

    • Waypoints.

    • Airports data (e.g., SIDs, STARs).

    • Radio aids.

    • Company-specific routes.
subject: Radio Navigation
